Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, did you hear that? My stomach is growling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh… I'm sooo hungry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about we go to that place we went to last time with Yangyang and Chixia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I love their food so much!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mmm... Yummy, yummy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello? Are you with me? {PlayerName}, you seem a bit distracted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With so much delicious food right in front of you, aren't you gonna try any? Well if you're not interested, I'll gobble it all up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been absent-minded the whole day. Still bothered by that dream from last night?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, so you had a dream about the Sentinel? Like the one from your flashback when we saw the Sentinel statue after you lost your memory?

Options.PlotLineKey: This time, I saw more.
This time, I saw something different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hang on, let me get this straight... The Sentinel swooshed you off to a mountain shaped like a dragon...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then there were all these bad things going on with lots and lots of Tacet Discords, but the Sentinel saved the day!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How exactly did it protect everyone again... Oh, in your dream it made the time different there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... The time in the mountains seemed to have slowed down from the outside, away from the Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel must have created a barrier by manipulating the flow of time, keeping those monsters out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was a safe haven from all the disturbances caused by the Tacet Discords, where people lived peacefully...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also... In my dream, I wasn't affected by the slowed time and could freely move in and out of the barrier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's no shock that you have awesome powers, being friends with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... What was that place you dreamed about called?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not entirely sure I heard it correctly, but in my dream, the Sentinel mentioned a place called Mt. Firmament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament? Never heard of it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiusi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You never heard of Mt. Firmament? Then I'm sure you're not from around here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on! Did you just say Mt. Firmament?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jiusi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my! Did that Echo just... talk?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's a good friend of mine.
Relax. It won't hurt you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qingxiang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, man, relax. You don't hear an Echo talking every day, but it's not that uncommon either!

Dialogues.Speaker: Qingxiang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard there's a country called Ri... Rinas... What? Anyway, the Echoes there are next level.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's up with this Mt. Firmament?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qingxiang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you're not from around here? Well, that explains why you don't know about Mt. Firmament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qingxiang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legends say Mt. Firmament is where the first people of Jinzhou lived. it looks like a giant statue of our Sentinel Jué.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qingxiang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never actually heard of anyone going to that place. They say those who try either get lost in the sea mist or never come back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qingxiang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're curious, just head southeast. Mt. Firmament is on the east side of Whining Aix's Mire, and you can see it from a distance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The southeast...

Options.PlotLineKey: What's your take? Any idea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The past few days, especially this morning, I caught this unique smell from the southeast. From that mountain they just mentioned.

Options.PlotLineKey: A unique smell... What do you mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's like a strong energy pulsing through the air, but I can't quite put my finger on it. It feels kind of weird though, doesn't smell natural...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it have anything to do with what you said? A place where time passes slowly?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Do you wanna go check it out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had a flashback about seeing their Sentinel... Perhaps that happened on Mt. Firmament...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can feel an unknown force guiding me, urging me to go there and find something...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi said she'll go search for the Sentinel and update me on its whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But so far, I have not heard anything from the City Hall yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... Shall we go check it out together? It feels really suspicious.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go ask Jinhsi about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At Gourmet Street, you discuss your dream involving the Sentinel and Mt. Firmament. A fellow diner shares insights about the mountain, and Abby senses a strange aura emanating from the southeast. Together, you resolve to seek information about the Sentinel at the City Hall.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... Shall we go check it out together? It feels really suspicious.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go ask Jinhsi about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At Gourmet Street, you discuss your dream involving the Sentinel and Mt. Firmament. A fellow diner shares insights about the mountain, and Abby senses a strange aura emanating from the southeast. Together, you resolve to seek information about the Sentinel at the City Hall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby, are you getting sleepy again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me... take a quick nap, all right? I've got keen ears. If anything goes down, just give me a holler, and I'll be... I'll be up in a jiffy… I swear…

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What can I help you with today?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm here for Jinhsi. I have questions about the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I regret to inform you that Madam Magistrate is not in the City Hall. She has left for Mt. Firmament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In fact... We have not heard back from her for days.

Options.PlotLineKey: So you don't know what she is up to?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, no. Please keep this confidential. The situation in Jinzhou is still unstable after our battle with the Threnodian. We must limit discussion of the Magistrate's whereabouts to a select few.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's going on?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When we captured Scar, he claimed that the Fractsidus has imprisoned our Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was around the same time that Madam Magistrate lost track of Sentinel Jué.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If our Sentinel is truly in danger… Or if someone with malicious intent obtains this information, the potential consequences could be as catastrophic as the previous Threnodian invasion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In order to investigate the Sentinel's whereabouts, Madam Magistrate has left for Mt. Firmament, its last recorded location.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did Jinhsi bring anyone with her? Bodyguards? Can you get in touch with them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate traveled to Mt. Firmament alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The looming threat of the Threnodian discouraged any additional divertion of human resources. Furthermore, when it comes to the Sentinel, force is not a viable solution.

Options.PlotLineKey: I need to go to Mt. Firmament to meet with the Sentinel.
Jinhsi might be in trouble, and I want to help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate trusts you. It is beyond my authorization to meddle in your decisions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, the landscape around Mt. Firmament is complex. One must be accompanied by a special "Wayfinder" to navigate safely. That's all I know.

Options.PlotLineKey: Where can I find this Wayfinder, then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Currently, she's likely at the ferry terminal in Whining Aix's Mire. I'll reach out to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To learn more about Mt. Firmament, you can meet her at the ferry. I lack the same level of understanding of the situation there as she does.

Options.PlotLineKey: All right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust Madam Magistrate's decisions. I will do my utmost to handle the public matters on her behalf while she is away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just... This worry about her safety won't leave me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In her last video message, I could tell she seemed weaker than usual, despite her efforts to maintain composure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate's situation might not be optimistic...

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, Mt. Firmament is a dangerous place. Please take care.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have sent the coordinates to your Terminal. Thank you for your kind help. I pray you will both return safely.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Abby.)
(Abby, are you there?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm listening!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, did you notice how the mountain has a strangely pleasant smell? It doesn't look edible though...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you hungry again?
I'm suddenly unsure whether I can count on you.
Go get some rest. I can handle it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not that I'm hungry or anything. I just tend to doze off easily. Feels like my body can only process what I consume while sleeping.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well of course I'm reliable! Even if I do happen to fall asleep and can't hear you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course you can! When I'm already so cool, you must be pretty amazing too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And don't worry, if there's any danger coming your way, I'll wake up like clockwork, just like last time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, unless there's nothing that can even remotely challenge you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case, I probably won't... wake... up...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In City Hall, Sanhua reveals that the Magistrate ventured to Mt. Firmament days ago, concerned for the Sentinel's safety. You express your intent to follow and Sanhua offers to contact a guide for the treacherous journey. She arranges a meeting with the Wayfinder at Whining Aix's Mire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's head to the ferry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Mt. Firmament. Our Wayfinder should have plenty information to share.
Are you trapped here by the rain?

Options.PlotLineKey: No, I'm waiting for someone.
Thank you.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I happen to be waiting for someone, too.
No need for thanks. We're about to embark on a journey together, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: Who are you?
Are you the "Wayfinder"?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Changli, your "Wayfinder."

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. The rain won't last much longer. Our destination lies just beyond it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, what do you know about Mt. Firmament?

Options.PlotLineKey: Not much.
It's the place where Jinzhou was founded?
What on earth is going on in that place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is... a certain folk tale. Have you heard of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While hiking in the mountains, a woodcutter came upon two people playing Weiqi and became enthralled with their game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon his return home, he found a world transformed. Everything was different, as if in a new reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That mountain was a secret realm where time worked differently. The woodcutter only spent half a day inside, but outside, a century had passed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament is such a place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But unlike this folk tale, there is a price to pay for entering and exiting its grounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I spend a full day in the mountains, ten days will be taken off my lifespan upon my leaving, reflecting the actual time that has passed outside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not to mention... the situation on Mt. Firmament right now is probably even more complex than before.

Options.PlotLineKey: What happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The strange time patterns of Mt. Firmament are tied to the Sentinel's Temporal Mandate. Time ebbs and flows at its will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Fractsidus really has imprisoned our Sentinel, causing it to lose control of its powers, that could explain the Temporal Disruptions... which means Mt. Firmament is basically a dead end with no way out.

Options.PlotLineKey: And you are heading straight into that dead end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lifespan is not the top of my concerns. If you've decided to venture there, I'll join you as your Wayfinder.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi has stayed on Mt. Firmament for too long.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sanhua said she might be in danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She doesn't miss a thing, does she?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before Jinhsi left for Mt. Firmament, scales began appearing on her body, and her Resonance Ability was weakening.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those signs pointed to a dire situation for the Sentinel as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I must lead you there. You might have the key to solving our dilemma.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're here because I invited you. Sanhua was instructed to disclose my whereabouts if you ever went to City Hall and asked about Jinhsi.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why would you tell me?
How did you know I'd go to the City Hall?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I understand, there is a strong link between you and the Sentinel. More importantly, you've been the primary target of the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's no surprise that you went to City Hall for answers, considering your memory loss and Jinhsi's prolonged absence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to tell you the truth... Because you've been the top priority—No, the sole concern of our enemy. The Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Overseer tried everything to sway you and make you join their side before our battle with the reviving Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a clear sign that your involvement could disrupt their plans, especially at Mt. Firmament.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why do they care so much about me?
It seems everyone's interested in me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Records at the Grand Library tell a tale of someone who dared to enter Mt. Firmament after the Sentinel's descent. And they emerged unscathed, as if time had no hold on them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were also said to have "stood alongside the Sentinel."

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And here before me stands someone who bears an uncanny resemblance to that very individual.

Options.PlotLineKey: You think that person is me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it you? If not you, who else could it be?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It took me some effort to finally reach this conclusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, the journey ahead is filled with danger at every turn. Once we venture into the mountains, there's no turning back. Are you sure you still want to join me?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes. The strange time pattern can't hurt me.
I am the key to solving your dilemma. Then why ask?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As your Wayfinder, I'll lead you to your destination. What you do after that is entirely up to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rain is subsiding, and the sky will soon clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, it's time for us to head out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the pouring rain, you encounter Changli, the Wayfinder, at the ferry. She describes the peculiar nature of time at Mt. Firmament, where it flows erratically. She notes your resemblance to a historic visitor who was immune to this temporal distortion and offers to accompany you into this dangerous realm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're at the base of Mt. Firmament, but we won't enter the Temporal Barrier until we cross the Luminous Shore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall we proceed? The storm is coming. Some people must be itching to pounce.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The bridge has broken...

Options.PlotLineKey: What's this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Judging by its design and intricate details, it must be a creation of the Court of Savantae.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is what they call a Chronosorter.

Options.PlotLineKey: What is that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It mimics the Sentinel's <ano=Ability to control time>Temporal Mandate</ano>, able to reverse small-scale events and restore objects to their previous state.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My master once told me about the Court of Savantae and their fearless quest to unravel the mysteries of Mt. Firmament, risking all in their pursuit of understanding the strange flow of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their dedication bore fruit in the form of fascinating inventions, such as this Chronosorter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it doesn't add up...

Options.PlotLineKey: What's wrong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why hasn't this brilliant invention spread beyond Mt. Firmament?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Chronosorter was built beyond the Temporal Barrier, so its creator must have already paid the price for leaving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But even if they died, there are countless other <ano=Court of Savantae Committee>CSC members</ano> who could replicate it. How did such advanced technology become lost?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or... do these Chronosorters stop functioning once they are removed from Mt. Firmament?

Options.PlotLineKey: What should we do now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Chronosorter, weathered though it may appear, bears no signs of neglect. Someone has tended to it diligently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's give it a try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Changli come to a damaged bridge that leads to Mt. Firmament. You find a Chronosorter in the vicinity, a Court of Savantae creation believed to have the power to restore objects by rewinding time. Perhaps it can be used to repair the bridge?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Weren't they concerned about losing lifespan?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For those fanatics, nothing mattered more than the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To live every moment with overwhelming passion... How many can claim such a tenacious drive and unshakable determination?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, it's the Fractsidus!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus... It's them again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've set traps all around the Luminous Shore...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They must have anticipated your arrival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The entrance is sealed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Photon Barrier. Another invention from the Court of Savantae.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Specific steps must be followed to undo the barrier. {PlayerName}, I'll guide you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use long-range weapons on the Photonvaults to cut off its energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we reach the cave's end, we'll enter the domain of Mt. Firmament. Proceed with caution.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it can't hurt me...

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this the effect of that strange time pattern you mentioned?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time on Mt. Firmament used to simply flow slower than in the outside world. Visitors were safe as long as they remained within the Temporal Barrier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But what we're seeing now is different. The flow of time has gone haywire. This is what we call the Temporal Disruptions...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What was once slow and steady has become chaotic and turbulent. Some areas are frozen in time, while others speed up or slow down unpredictably.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one knows how much they'll age after leaving Mt. Firmament, but aging from youth to old age may be a blessing compared to the unknown fate that awaits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leaving Mt. Firmament could turn any mortal to dust in just a moment. Such is the power of time within its walls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These poor creatures, trapped in the Temporal Disruption, are the most pitiful of all... Their bodies and minds have been ravaged by the chaotic time, leaving them in unimaginable suffering...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, it looks like the Fractsidus did manage to capture our Sentinel, leading to the Temporal Disruptions we are facing now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had wished that my theories would turn out wrong...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...As expected, my Terminal isn't working. We can't reach Jinhsi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Temporal Disruption is preventing it from functioning.

Options.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't waste a moment. Jinhsi's fate isn't the only one at stake—all the inhabitants of Mt. Firmament are in danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to hurry to Hongzhen, a town nestled at the heart of Mt. Firmament. Jinhsi would likely pass through there on her search for the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon entering Mt. Firmament, you find that the flow of time has spiraled out of control, with many creatures falling victim to it. Leaving the mountain now could lead to unpredictable aging. Changli finds her Terminal is not working and suggests hurrying to Hongzhen, a town that Jinhsi must pass through in her search for the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Temporal Disruptions have spared nothing on our way here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli, does that mean you're in danger too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So far, nothing feels out of the ordinary. It seems the Sentinel contained the situation before being fully trapped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I don't know how long this stability will hold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, if I go down... please don't worry about me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You need only focus on what you have to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the matter, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: I dreamed of this place...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You dreamed of Hongzhen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Changli about the flashing images you saw in your dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It sounds like you did dream of this place.

Options.PlotLineKey: I dreamed of Hongzhen being attacked by TDs.
I dreamed of the Sentinel protecting people here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you just described closely aligns with the accounts documented in our Grand Library.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over a century ago, a vast horde of Tacet Discords invaded Huanglong. Hongzhen suffered greatly during that onslaught.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thankfully, the Sentinel descended, manipulating time to erect a protective barrier, keeping those monsters at bay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, perhaps... That dream is more than just a dream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It could be a glimpse into your own past, and... a guiding light for the future.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hongzhen is a pivotal location, linking various parts of Mt. Firmament. With the Fractsidus now targeting us, they'll seize any opportunity to intercept our path.

Options.PlotLineKey: They've laid a trap in Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But every trap has its weak points.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone has used their Resonance Ability here, but it feels different from the Fractsidus' aggression... It's Jinhsi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it seems like she used it in a dire situation. Could it be related to the people of Hongzhen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traces lead deeper into the heart of Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's keep moving, {PlayerName}. Don't let your guard down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hongzhen resembles a place from your dreams. Changli speculates that your dreams might be a glimpse into your past and a light guiding you into the future. Here, you meet the Fractsidus and discover traces of Jinhsi's Resonance Ability, and you decide to follow them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone fought here against those Fractsidus...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must be Jinhsi. Her trails led to this location.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Using her Resonance Ability too much would only worsen her condition...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But she must have had a reason. Was she helping the people of Hongzhen find refuge?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli, there are traces here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're pointing north. Let's proceed in that direction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traces disappear by the pond.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we need to keep an eye out for anything unusual.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This vase on the stone table seems rather peculiar.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the Sound behind the Waterfall

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's something behind the waterfall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go take a look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another Photon Barrier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Three Photonvaults to break. {PlayerName}, use ranged attacks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe you are here for Magistrate Jinhsi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Magistrate left Hongzhen about fifteen minutes ago. She should be at the Truthseeker's Pass now.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Truthseeker's Pass?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's what they call it in Hongzhen. You might know it better as the ruins of a Court of Savantae facility.

Options.PlotLineKey: What is Jinhsi doing there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Xinyi, please elaborate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate, are you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm… fine…

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's the situation? Have we evacuated all the civilians?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Remaining civilians have been counted and escorted to safety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. These hidden chambers should provide some much-needed shelter for them to rest a little...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despite being the Sentinel's Appointed Resonator, I haven’t been able to sense its presence for some time now…

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can feel my Resonance Ability waning, and I get my power from the Sentinel. This can only mean one thing: the Sentinel's condition is getting worse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Xinyi, I need to know where the Sentinel was last seen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can only fix the Temporal Disruption within a confined radius. It's already pushing my limits to keep this small pocket of space secure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament is in serious trouble, and we can't waste any more time. We need our Sentinel to stabilize the time flow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel was last seen flying towards Mianloong Chamber, where it would normally rest. The Fractsidus likely swarmed it soon after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But little did they know, we had a defense system in place, built with the help of the Court of Savantae. It was reactivated as soon as our Sentinel made it back inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This mechanism has allowed us to locate their troops, and we've already eliminated some of them outside the Mianloong Chamber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To get inside Mianloong Chamber, we have to find the Cipher Key in Truthseeker's Pass and unseal it with the Keyforge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. I will go bring back the Cipher Key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are injured. Please rest and leave it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus will most likely attack this place once I leave. You must stay here and guard it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I implore you, Xinyi. Help me keep our people safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes, I will, Madam Magistrate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before I headed to Mt. Firmament, the Fractsidus revealed a prophecy from our Sentinel: a fateful clash between the Sentinel and myself that would shape the fate of our city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never intended to believe their baseless claims, but I was not surprised to hear it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel had told me long ago that there would come a day when I surpass it in power. A day when the humans of Jinzhou take control of their own destiny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we save the Sentinel from danger, I intend to have a serious conversation with it about this prophecy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And then she left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's still one thing that doesn't add up—How did the Fractsidus kidnap our Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Mianloong Chamber was once renovated by the Court of Savantae. Do you think their research could be involved somehow?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll look into what you said, but once we have the Cipher Key, the Mianloong Chamber will be left vulnerable to the Fractsidus' potential retaliation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must keep them at bay...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName} and I are headed to the Truthseeker's Pass to meet up with Jinhsi. We'll distract the Fractsidus main forces, giving you an opportunity to stage your ambush.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the locals will handle the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will send some men to open up the side exit for you. Head south and keep walking a couple of minutes, and you will see the Truthseeker's Pass downstream.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Lady Xinyi. Please leave it to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this place she was born, and in this place she returns. Our Magistrate's fate is bound to Mt. Firmament...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You learn that the Sentinel may be trapped in its resting place—the Mianloong Chamber. The Fractsidus invasion has activated the defenses built by the Court of Savantae, sealing the chamber. Jinhsi left shortly before to go to Truthseeker's Pass to retrieve the Cipher Key needed to unseal it. You and Changli continue to trace her steps.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Any other questions for me, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Ask about the Temporal Disruption.)
(Ask about Mianloong Chamber.)
(Ask about the Mianloong Chamber's defense.)
(Ask about the Cipher Key.)
(Ask about the lifespan cost of leaving.)
I have nothing to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This crisis hit Hongzhen hard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People were going about their day as usual, but then chaos erupted without warning. They didn't even have the time to escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our town is made up of ordinary individuals, and we had no way to defend ourselves against the Temporal Disruptions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to Magistrate Jinhsi, we didn't get too many casualties.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel caused this disaster by trying to protect people...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We understand our Sentinel is not to blame for what has transpired.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou stands thanks to the Sentinel's never-faltering protection. It saved our ancestors from the Tacet Discords. Without the Sentinel, this land would be uninhabitable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The current situation could be much worse without the Sentinel's aid. We are grateful for its help and can't expect anything more from it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...As our Sentinel once protected the people of Mt. Firmament from Tacet Discords, it seems we'll need to rely on Magistrate Jinhsi this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many outsiders are unaware, but in ancient times, a colossal vehicle descended upon Mt. Firmament alongside our Sentinel. This became the Mianloong Chamber as we know it today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People in Hongzhen believe our Sentinel came from a faraway star and the chamber serves as its hibernation pod.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But with our limited technology, we still struggle to comprehend its workings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which... Our Sentinel's health is worsening. Lately, it has been spending longer periods of time in the Mianloong Chamber, essentially going back to "sleep" more frequently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've tried asking about it, but no response.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The defense mechanisms outside Mianloong Chamber were built by the Court of Savantae.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back in the day, researchers from the Court of Savantae would often come to Mt. Firmament to study the strange time fluctuations. This caused tension with the locals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Local people believed it was disrespectful to the Sentinel, especially when they tried to enter Mianloong Chamber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After some deliberation, local people understood that the Court of Savantae posed no threat to the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A deal was struck: the locals would refrain from disrupting their research, and in return, they would build defense mechanisms to keep outsiders from interrupting the Sentinel's rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel was believed to have agreed to this compromise by remaining silent during negotiations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Activating the Cipher Key is a complex process, and we've stored the Mianloong Chamber's controller separately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's an extra safeguard. By splitting the key and its control panel, it'll be harder for malicious individuals to access them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long ago, the Sentinel protected people of Hongzhen from Tacet Discords, and it also revealed a harsh truth—

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leaving Mt. Firmament shortened one's lifespan exponentially. The longer someone has lived inside the Temporal Barrier, the less likely they can make it out alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later, a group of brave young people who could afford the aging left Mt. Firmament, and they eventually built Jinzhou city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Others stayed and worshiped the Sentinel as their god, vowing to protect it for generations and carving its likeness into the mountain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I pray for your safe return. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have other responsibilities to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did Xinyi and Jinhsi know each other?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi was chosen as a baby for her Resonance Ability, and raised in City Hall to become the Sentinel's Appointed Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All the government workers there helped care for and teach her at some point, including Lady Xinyi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She grew up with immense responsibilities, forced to suppress her true nature from a young age. Thinking back, Jinhsi was only a teenage girl when she became the Magistrate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She has been burdened with unimaginable weight that most cannot fathom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I assume this is the Truthseeker's Pass Xinyi mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This should be another Chronosorter. It should work in similar ways with the one we saw near the Luminous Shore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The entrance is built on that cliff, and it's been blocked...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will need to break the three Photonvaults with ranged attacks first.

Options.PlotLineKey: What is it, Changli?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing. I was wondering, how did the Court of Savantae create such an advanced mechanism using the Sentinel's power? Mortals aren't supposed to be able to comprehend it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never heard of any human civilization having the ability to manipulate time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless the Sentinel willingly taught them... But why?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to focus on items related to the Court of Savantae in Truthseeker's Pass. Maybe we can find some clues there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At Truthseeker's Pass, you find another Chronosorter alongside three Photonvaults. Changli marvels at how the Court of Savantae managed to manipulate time to create such sophisticated mechanisms, noting that no other civilization has been able to replicate this technology. She speculates that this knowledge must have originated from the Sentinel.

Chapters.Title: Disable the Photon Barrier on the gate and enter Truthseeker's Pass
Throw the Tacetite Fulminate at the cracks in the Ledge Wheels to create a path
Disable the Photon Barrier on the gate to Truthseeker's Pass

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are there Tacet Discord here? No, these monsters... They don't look like the usual Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These, too, look like the works of the Court of Savantae.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did they create these simulated holograms to protect this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Did you see the Tacetite Fulminate on that cliff? Perhaps we can create an opening in this disk with an explosion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blockade has been lifted. Let's go in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One of the Photonvault always ends up blocked off. We can't seem to break three of them at once... {PlayerName}, perhaps we'll need to use the Chronosorter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Are we going to aim the opening in that disk at the Photonvault in the middle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It worked! The opening fits right onto the middle Photonvault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, now we can hit the three Photonvaults simultaneously.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Decades have passed, but those researchers' presence still lingers in this place...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That thing up ahead... Is it another mechanism?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to have unlocked after we got rid of those holograms. Let's go and have a look.

Chapters.Title: Approach and activate the Flare Stone, then put out the Flare Crest (Part One)

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The glowing patterns on that gate... It's a Flare Crest.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did the Court of Savantae build this too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The Flare Crests have a complex structure, but they can be deciphered with patience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See how each star represents a Flare Stone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That mechanism we accidentally solved earlier should be one of them.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's why the corresponding star has dimmed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, we still need the other two Flare Stones to open it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blood and scales here... It's Jinhsi.

Options.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi was injured?
What happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She is likely teetering on the edge of Overclocking now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are running out of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The stone gate, marked with the Flare Crest, has stars that correspond to Flare Stones. To unlock the gate, you need to find and activate the other two stones. Changli discovers traces left by Jinhsi nearby and deduces that she may be on the verge of Overlocking.

Chapters.Title: Leave the upper tier of Truthseeker's Pass for the middle tier
Leave the upper tier of Truthseeker's Pass for the middle tier

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's situation is worse than we thought. It had already sustained severe injuries when it descended upon Mt. Firmament...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "With one of the Temporal Programs lost"... It no longer had the power to restore time, instead it could only stop and rewind it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the Sentinel protected Hongzhen with its power, but it couldn’t return things back to normal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It would seem so...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to their theories, the Sentinel's injury would worsen over time. And if the Sentinel perishes... the Temporal Disruptions will spiral out of control, engulfing all of Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the Fractsidus just added a pinch of salt to the already gaping wounds on Mt. Firmament...

Options.PlotLineKey: Is there any way to cure the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is nothing we can do. At least that's what it says in these records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only the Mianloong Chamber can provide temporary relief for the Sentinel, but it won't heal it completely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the end, the Sentinel and a "peculiar visitor" who was immune to Time Disruptions would have to come up with a last resort.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Chronosorters.
The "Resonance".

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel couldn't be fixed, so they decided to replicate its power onto a Resonator through induced Resonance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their experiments resulted in the first Chronosorter—a manmade Resonance Object.

Options.PlotLineKey: So it worked?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. A Chronosorter can only rewind time within a narrow range. It's no match for the Sentinel's immense power.

Options.PlotLineKey: If objects didn't work, then... What if it was a person...
Jinhsi...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are getting closer and closer to the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Two more Flare Stones left. Everything aside, first we must find Jinhsi.

Chapters.Title: Leave the upper tier of Truthseeker's Pass for the middle tier
Leave the upper tier of Truthseeker's Pass for the middle tier
Leave the upper tier of Truthseeker's Pass for the middle tier

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another Chronosorter... The second Flare Stone should be behind this gate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, let's restore the collapsed gate with this Chronosorter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at that device on the floating slab. It could help us open the path to other places. Shall we give it a try?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm. So it turned you into a Clang Bang?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, please use the "Leap Device" to eject yourself and crash through that ice wall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another Chronosorter. Let's give it a try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is still another Photonvault to break. We can't reach it from here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We may need to look around for a better vantage point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This hidden area may allow us to reach that Photonvault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The stone slates have formed a path. Now we can bring the Tacetite Fulminate across the water.

Chapters.Title: Operate the Chronosorter and find a way to leave the chamber
Approach and activate the Flare Stone, then put out the Flare Crest (Part Two)

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last Flare Stone to go. There's a Carrier Lift nearby... Is the Flare Stone on the floor beneath us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should be able to find Jinhsi soon...

Chapters.Title: Take the Carrier Lift to the lower tier
Take the Carrier Lift to the lower tier

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so...

Options.PlotLineKey: What does it say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this file confirms that the Chronosorters are artificial Resonance Objects.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They activate when hit with a strong impact to create the corresponding Resonance Effects.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this also answers my previous question: the Chronosorters rewind time through resonating with the Sentinel.

Options.PlotLineKey: That sounds really powerful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it was nowhere near enough. The Chronosorters shut down once they are removed from the Sentinel's range or the abnormal time flow on Mt. Firmament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plus, as artificial Resonance Objects, their capacity is limited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the Court of Savantae researchers, there was a hypothesis that could potentially make them more powerful—the Second Resonance Awakening hypothesis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which states the collision between two resonating frequencies might cause a Second Resonance Awakening...

Options.PlotLineKey: That prophecy...
A destined fight between Jinhsi and the Sentinel...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes. That fight has to happen to trigger a Second Resonance Awakening for Jinhsi, so she may exert even stronger Resonance Abilities... Ones that allow her to restore the flow of time.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did the Court of Savantae's research succeed?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Countless Chronosorters were made to collide with the Sentinel's frequencies, but they were no match. All the machines turned to dust.

Options.PlotLineKey: Without exception?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One Chronosorter briefly showed the power to restore time before breaking apart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This proved that a Second Awakening can indeed improve Resonance Ability.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The research log mentioned that all Chronosorters were working in an overdrive mode.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: —It's similar to how human Resonators experience Overclocking, they wrote.

Options.PlotLineKey: What is Overclocking?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Overclocking happens when a Resonator overexerts their ability. And this researcher who wrote this suggests that it might be the key to triggering a Second Awakening.

Options.PlotLineKey: It doesn't sound like a good thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it's not. Exhausting oneself will only result in destruction...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In addition, I noticed another detail in these records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Chronosorters required manual control, while the Sentinel Jué appeared to be under someone else's command.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that only incident of success, just as the 'Chronosorter' was about to break down, that "peculiar visitor" gave an order to the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Sentinel successfully transferred some kind of energy to the Chronosorter thanks to that order.

Options.PlotLineKey: Overclocking...
When the Chronosorter almost broke down...
Energy transmission...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, do you have an idea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The documents show that the Court of Savantae used Chronosorters to test the Second Resonance Awakening hypothesis, which suggests that colliding frequencies can unlock greater potential within a Resonator. You theorize that the prophesied conflict between Jinhsi and the Sentinel is intended to allow Jinhsi to acquire the ability to manipulate time through this Second Resonance. However, the experiments indicate that the Resonator's Overlocking may be necessary to attain this power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. {PlayerName} is special. The Temporal Dusruption can't hurt {Male=him;Female=her}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... *cough*... but Changli, your...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I gave my word to be your pawn and I intend to keep it. As your teacher and courtier, it is only right for me to do so.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And let's not forget, without me playing the Wayfinder for {PlayerName}, we wouldn't even have {Male=him;Female=her} here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName} has a strong connection to this place. You need {Male=his;Female=her} help to resolve Mt. Firmament's crisis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... We already owe {PlayerName} a lot.

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't mind helping you again.
I'm here to find out about my past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}... Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As we headed toward Mt. Firmament, {PlayerName} mentioned a strange dream {Male=he;Female=she} had. It may have been a flashback of {Male=his;Female=her} lost memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, Jué, and Mt. Firmament... There must be some kind of crucial connection between the three. {PlayerName} also has {Male=his;Female=her} own reasons for being here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I will do everything I can to rescue the Sentinel as soon as possible, then we can finally talk to it in person. It will surely have the answers you want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's cut to the chase.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did you find in Truthseeker's Pass, Jinhsi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the Court of Savantae's records... the Sentinel was already injured upon its arrival at Mt. Firmament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As time passed and its condition worsened, the flow of time became unstable here, causing Temporal Disruptions that could potentially threaten Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only the Sentinel's Appointed Resonator can restore its <ano=ability to control time>Temporal Mandate</ano>...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their records indicate a solution.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To reverse the rapid aging effect from Temporal Disruptions, I must deliberately collide with the Sentinel's Resonance power during combat—triggering my Second Resonance Awakening. That will enhance my power beyond its limits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's say you can achieve all that, but Jinhsi... Do you understand what is at stake for yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I share a Resonance connection with Jué, but I never took the time to truly get to know it... I've been blind to its suffering for so long...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sentinel Jué has been guiding us since the city's founding with its wise words and well-crafted decisions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Temporal Disruptions we face are just a side effect of its efforts to protect local people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Without the Sentinel blocking out Tacet Discords through its time-manipulation power, Jinzhou would be a barren wasteland today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what do you plan to do, Jinhsi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Sentinel's condition is indeed incurable... Nobody knows how far the Temporal Disruptions will continue to spread.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today it's Mt. Firmament, but tomorrow it could be all of Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I will...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it truly comes down to that, I'll fulfill Jué's prophecy myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the only way to save Mt Firmament, protect Jinzhou, and help the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you thought about the consequences, Jinhsi?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trying to trigger a Second Awakening by fighting the Sentinel... It could make you Overclock at any moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We both know what that means. You could lose your mind forever, or even disintegrate into dust... You don't want to end up like those Chronosorters, shredded under immense pressure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On top of that... Do you honestly believe you can fight in your current condition?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can see right through your façade, Jinhsi. You're essentially committing suicide at this point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're one to talk, my teacher.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I learned from the best. When have you ever backed down from risking your life for what you believe in?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? I don't remember ever teaching you that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We all die eventually, but we need to stay alive as long as we can to achieve more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi, you must live and inherit the Sentinel's power. Then you can save and protect these people for years to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli... I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ... Jinhsi, I don't intend to stop you. I know you've made up your mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I brought {PlayerName} here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You may have already guessed it. {PlayerName} is indeed the hero who fought by our Sentinel's side during Jinzhou's early days. {Male=He;Female=She} is also the mysterious visitor spoken of in tales about Mt. Firmament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All evidence we've gathered points to this being true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anyone can help us with the situation at Mt. Firmament, it must be {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't remember anything, but I can fight.
I'm strong. It wouldn't hurt to help.
There might be other options.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, my teacher... Jinhsi will keep your words in mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lastly, we still don't know for sure how the Fractsidus is keeping our Sentinel trapped. This will determine if you can actually meet it face to face.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe the Fractsidus are just really strong...
They might be using the Court of Savantae's mechanisms.
Maybe they manipulated the Sentinel's weakness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it could be any of these scenarios. Lady Xinyi is already on the case. We should get an answer soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Cipher Key should be inside the stone chamber, behind its entrance gate. There is one more Flare Stone to work out. Let's get moving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You finally find Jinhsi, who appears greatly weakened. She has learned from the Court of Savantae's records that the Sentinel was injured upon arriving at Mt. Firmament, and its worsening condition is causing the increasingly unstable flow of time. With Jinzhou endangered, Jinhsi intends to verify the Court's claims for herself. If necessary, she is prepared to engage the Sentinel in battle to trigger a Second Resonance, even if it means risking her life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, our last target. On those floating floor tiles. We need a way to restore them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not working... We may need to follow a specific order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It worked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Court of Savantae set many traps here. They must have worked hard to protect Mianloong Chamber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a trap! {PlayerName}, watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something above the Carrier Lift seems stuck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've reached the Carrier Lift.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Interesting. It seems the one who was immune to the Temporal Disruption provided insights on the invention of Chronosorters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was to say, the Court of Savantae had such a thorough understanding of Temporal Disruptions, and there was a trace of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What does it say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The documents show that the Court of Savantae used Chronosorters to test the Second Resonance Awakening hypothesis, which suggests that colliding frequencies can unlock greater potential within a Resonator. You theorize that the prophesied conflict between Jinhsi and the Sentinel is intended to allow Jinhsi to acquire the ability to manipulate time through this Second Resonance. However, the experiments indicate that the Resonator's Overlocking may be necessary to attain this power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel never tried to interfere with natural death before. Why did it make an exception?

Chapters.Title: Turn off Photonvault and operate Chronosorter
Approach and activate the Flare Stone, then put out the Flare Crest (Part Three)

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last Flare Stone to go. There's a Carrier Lift nearby... Is the Flare Stone on the floor beneath us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should be able to find Jinhsi soon...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm done with all three Flare Stones.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Let's head back to the entrance. We should be able to access the Cipher Key now.

Chapters.Title: Take the Carrier Lift to the upper tier

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Cipher Key...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, take good care of the Cipher Key.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm leaving the rest to you and Jinhsi.

Options.PlotLineKey: What about you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please don't forget: I am your Wayfinder. I journeyed with you into the mountains to ensure you meet up with Jinhsi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From this point onward, I will be counting on you both to go and confront the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is all I can do for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here to guide, not intervene. The path is yours to choose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not to mention... the Fractsidus has been pestering us non-stop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll need someone to keep them at bay.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus are here for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, they've been constantly watching you, interested in your every move. They can never seem to take their eyes off of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By all means, please carry on without me. As for myself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a more fitting location to make my contributions from.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, "speak of the devils"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the depths of Truthseeker's Pass, you find the Cipher Key needed to unlock the Mianloong Chamber. Changli tells you that she has successfully fulfilled her mission to bring you to Jinhsi and chooses to stay behind to handle the troublesome Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How rude. This is not how we greet people here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to demonstrate the proper etiquette.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those Artificers are nothing to worry about. {PlayerName}, don't worry. Changli has her plans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't believe we will run into more ambushes on the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Madam Magistrate! She's back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bing'ge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must go tell Lady Xinyi!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Xinyi places the Cipher Key onto the Keyforge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Mianloong Chamber is open now. You can proceed inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before you go, there's something important I need to tell you.

Options.PlotLineKey: About how the Fractsidus imprisoned your Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli was right. They used the Court of Savantae's research to trap our Sentinel in its resting chamber.

Options.PlotLineKey: How did they do it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They used the Chronosorters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our captured Artificer revealed that the Fractsidus sent a death squad to invade Mt. Firmament. They had a two-fold plan…

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First, to place the Chronosorter in the Mianloong Chamber while it was still operational; and second, to lure the Sentinel back to Mt. Firmament.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although their death squad was no match for the Sentinel, by forcing its hand, the powerful Resonance Ability of the Sentinel would clash with the energy of the Chronosorter. This would ultimately cause harm to itself.

Options.PlotLineKey: Would that really make any difference?
How could some Chronosorters trap the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What if the Fractsidus modified those Chronosorters?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A whole bunch of them, pushed to their limits, all working together to deliver one massive blow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But not even that was enough to take down the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the first hit, they set up modified Flare Crests in the Mianloong Chamber to form a special force field along with those Chronosorters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It prevented the Sentinel from replenishing energy and eventually restricted its movement and perception.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... We must free the Sentinel from that force field first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It would be a task more complicated than it sounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The people of Hongzhen have lived with the Sentinel for generations. We can usually tell if it's in good shape or not.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, the Fractsidus want to capture the Sentinel... They won't just stop at Mt. Firmament. Madam Magistrate, I'm sure you didn't come here just for the Sentinel...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please tell us what you know, Madam Magistrate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I will tell you everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi updates Xinyi on her findings at Truthseeker's Pass and shares her theory about the situation. She then outlines her current plans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the Sentinel is actually injured, and it's been getting worse... The Fractsidus attacked while it hasn't healed yet. Their plans are devious as always.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Magistrate, you've already laid out this plan so far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's always a challenge to decipher the Sentinel's intentions, but there were many theories about it in City Hall at the time. I couldn't fathom why it went through such great lengths to retrieve you from Mt. Firmament and raise you within our walls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now that I reflect on it, perhaps the Sentinel saw in you the potential to one day restore the Temporal Program and ensure the survival of Jinzhou's inhabitants.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just never thought.. You'd be willing to follow through with that prophecy…

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was here on this very mountain that I first encountered the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, I was too young to remember anything. Even the image of Mt. Firmament has slipped from my mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this time... As soon as I stood at the base of Mt. Firmament, I felt a wave of recognition wash over me. Memories long buried resurfaced with sudden clarity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Xinyi... I was born with my life, my everything connected to our Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But my duty as its Appointed Resonator is not the only reason for my decision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'm following the heart of my younger self before I became Jinhsi: The girl who used to laugh with pure joy as she felt the snow from Mt. Firmament on her face.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am a seed, born on Mt. Firmament, carried by the wind to every corner of Jinzhou. But now, I have returned to my place of origin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time for me to take root and grow into something greater...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sigh... No matter what happens or what choices you make, please remember: the people of Hongzhen will always have your back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament has been stagnant for eternity. Perhaps a sudden crack of lightning is what we need to break through the fog of uncertainty that has lingered over us for far too long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Jinhsi return to Hongzhen, and with Xinyi's help, unlock the Mianloong Chamber. You discover that the Fractsidus has used a Court of Savantae creation to generate a special force field that prevents Jué from drawing energy from the chamber, effectively trapping it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once you pass through Hongzhen, keep your eyes open for a cave on the northern cliff. That will lead you to a shortcut towards Mianloong Chamber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The place is directly under Mt. Firmament's iconic Loong-shaped cliff. I wish you two the best of luck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinhsi, so far, everything we know about the Sentinel is still just speculation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are right. But my weakening Resonance Ability and my connection to the Sentinel leave me no choice but to explore these theories...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether it's fact or fiction, truth or a lie...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have to confront the Sentinel and see for myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Mianloong Chamber should be deep in the cave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...This must be the Mianloong Chamber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should now help the Sentinel break free from the Flare Crest's binds.

Options.PlotLineKey: The water surface isn't moving at all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chronosorters nearby may have frozen this body of water in time, or it could've been caused by the Temporal Disruptions here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Either way, we can use it to our advantage... We can walk over the water now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...We are too far away to see what's going on inside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, let's go. I still need more information to determine what we should do next.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon entering the Mianloong Chamber, you find a body of water frozen in time. Can you walk across the water's surface to get to the other side?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can feel the Sentinel's presence inside, but it's not responding...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Flare Crest...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel is telling us... We need to find the three Flare Stones corresponding to the Flare Crest, then we will be able to lift the confinement set by the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm not seeing any Flare Stones. Or any kind of entrance to another chamber.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There seems to be something underwater. Let's start with the Chronosorter here.

Chapters.Title: Operate the Chronosorter to adjust the water level

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The water level has dropped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Flare Stone. On that rock!

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go retrieve it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Two more to go. Let's look for them nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Flare Stone is right here, but we have to open this Photon Barrier first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, this barrier will break down once the corresponding Photonvaults are destroyed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...One of the Photonvaults is in there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to find a way to destroy the Spikes with the Corroder's help... Same as last time, let's locate the Photonvault first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The remaining Photonvault is hidden behind the Fissured Ledge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fissured Ledge... If only there was a Tacetite Fulminate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, let's look around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are stone slabs above. Try using the Chronosorter to restore them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. Now we can work that Flare Stone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last Flare Stone to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Flare Stone is up there... We need to raise the water level with the corresponding Chronosorter first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All set. The Sentinel should be able to break free now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes, I believe so.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's head back to the Sentinel's place.

Options.PlotLineKey: What does it say?

Chapters.Title: Approach and activate the Flare Stone to put out the Flare Crest (Part One)
Approach and activate the Flare Stone to put out the Flare Crest (Part Two)
Use the Tacetite Fulminate to destroy the Fissured Ledge
Approach and activate the Flare Stone to put out the Flare Crest (Part Two)
Use the Tacetite Fulminate to destroy the Fissured Ledge
Approach and activate the Flare Stone to put out the Flare Crest (Part Three)
Return to Mianloong Chamber and inspect the hibernation pod

Options.PlotLineKey: The "deceased infant" here, is it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... It's me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've lived in Jinzhou my whole life and never ventured into Hongzhen, yet even I know of the legend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To me, Jué is more than just our Sentinel or a revered divine being... It raised me and saved me from certain death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been thinking about it on our way here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Sentinel predicted our fight, why would it even bother saving me in the first place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Jinhsi
